forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Hello I'm trying to make a MultiBoot USB with Windows XP, Windows 7 and Hiren's Boot Cd
I made it with Grub4Dos and Firadisk loading ISO's directly.
But the WinXp installation failed, and Win7 installation was very slowly. Now i'm trying to make it extracting the ISO to make the installation faster, but i don't know how to do it.
Thanks in advance

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: For a USB Flash drive see www.rmprepusb.com. [Tutorial #63](http://www.rmprepusb.com/tutorials/install-xp-and-win7-to-internal-hdd "External link") and add to it [Tutorial #36](http://www.rmprepusb.com/tutorials/hbcd "External link").

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Thanks in advance The ISO Load using Firadisk worked great
I will try what you said and i will post the result
Nice to meet you, and thanks for your tutorials

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Hi again I followed all the steps of #63 tutorial and i got these errors: On winXP error copying winblock and firadisk after selecting those drivers can't find OEMbinun7zip.exe after beginning the 2nd step of the installatin On WIn7 Warning SOURCEINSTALL.WIN not found

¿Is there a way to do this extracting the iso directly on the USB drive?
Thanks **Edited by dagonas, 06 June 2012 - 08:38 AM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Did you use an MS source ISO or a 'special' one of your own?  
The tutorials are for MS install ISOs.  
You can simply extract the Win 7 source DVD and then use a grub4dos menu to boot to chainloader /bootmgr.  

Are you trying to run Win 7 and XP from a USB Flash drive or install Win 7 and XP from a USB flash drive?

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
It's a special ISO... I want to make an USB for installing XP or Windows 7
I will try extracting the ISO, but what do i have to do for WinXp?
Thanks again

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Try running [WinSetupFromUSB](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/120444-how-to-install-windows-from-usb-winsetupfromusb-with-gui/ "External link") and then transferring the files over to your multiboot stick.

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
It seems it works  

I will try doing a complete installation of each one this afternoon  

I'll tell you the result  

Thanks again for your help

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Hi again I'm getting an error installing forn WinSetup with Windows 7 and Windows Xp
Is there a way to start the installation with Grub4dos? Thank you

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
What error?  
Did you test your USB drive using RMPrepUSB Quick Size Test? It may be faulty?

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Hello again I'm going to tell you the steps i have made: 1) Winsetupfromusb with options: Auto format it with Fbinst, NTFS, Align Section "Add to USB DISK" Windows 2000/XP/2003 Setup Checked and the correct drive with an iso mounted inside the textbox Windows Vista / 7 ... Setup Checked and the correct drive with an iso mounted inside the textbox 2) Start the process 3) Try each installation a) On Windows XP, when i started the second part of the installation it get hanged when the installation said "39 minutes left" :cool: On Windows 7, it get hanged when the installation reached the Blue Screen of the installation beginning.

It seems WinSetupfromUSB have a problem detecting the USB pendrive
Is there another way to do this Multiboot?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
What system are you testing it on and what USB port (USB 2 or 3) are you using?  
Did you try QEMU for Win 7 boot?

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Yes, i tried the QEMU and worked  

It takes a long time to show the screen on the computer where i inserted the USB  

It's a USB 2.0 port

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: So what system are you testing it on? Does it have SATA drives, what chipset, what mainboard, etc.

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
I have tried it on different system  

The Win7 installation started a hour ago and now is on 77% expanding files  

So it is going VERY slowly  

The system is:  

Mainboard: MSI N1996  
Chipset: VIA  
Hardisk: SATA  

But yesterday i tried it on a different system with a PATA hard disk

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Hi again  

what about this method?  

[https://sites.google...and-server-2008](https://sites.google.com/site/rmprepusb/tutorials/how-to-create-a-usb-drive-that-will-install-vista-win7-and-server-2008 "External link")  

do you think it may help?  

THANKS

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
I think the problem is that the first system has a strange mass storage controller and the 2nd one has slow USB ports.  
MSI N1996 is not the board name, all MSI boards have MSI N1996 on them - the name should be something like MS-6359.  
Did you test your USB drive with RMPrepUSB Quick Size Test?   
For XP set the BIOS HDD mode to IDE not AHCI.

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
I have tried another source and all went ok. Now i'm thinking about how may i put two different sources of Windows XP (one clean and another modified) to install one or other depending on the situation Do you know how can i do that?
Thanks

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Well you can have two ISOs, but if one is modified it might not work in the same way. I can't really help with the modified one...

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content: But Installing from ISO is too slow

forumNotes.author: Mah Moua
forumNotes.content:
The easiest is to boot hiren from grub4dos  
mount the iso (xp or 7) with eg imdisk  
There are 2 "fast" installers under programs/others in hiren's menu one for xp (winntsetup)  
and another for win6/7 (nt6.x fast installer)  

If you want to install xp directly from iso use winvblock. Make the iso file contigious with wincontig  
You can copy the xp iso (as one file) to your hard disk first. The installation is much faster  
Win7 directly from iso is difficult  

Below are the menu.lst enteries for xp with winvblock usb  

title Install Windows XP from iso with winvblock   
find --set-root --ignore-floppies /xpsp3.iso  
map /winvblock.ima (fd0)  
map /winvblock.ima (fd1)  
map /xpsp3.iso (0xff)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd0) (hd1)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd1) (hd0)  
map --hook  
chainloader (0xff)  

title Continue Windows XP setup with winvblock  
find --set-root --ignore-floppies /xpsp3.iso  
map /winvblock.ima (fd0)  
map /winvblock.ima (fd1)  
map /xpsp3.iso (0xff)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd0) (hd1)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd1) (hd0)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd0)+1

forumNotes.author: dagonas
forumNotes.content:
Thanks, Mah Moua. I will try what you said. Steve, i'm getting the Stop error 0x0000007B so as i read in your Tutorial, i have to include the AHCI driver. [http://www.rmprepusb...-xp-from-an-iso](http://www.rmprepusb.com/tutorials/install-xp-from-an-iso "External link")
What do i have to do if i have this folder structure?
![Posted Image](http://i48.tinypic.com/dnysrk.jpg)
And the file menu.lst ``` title Windows XP/2000/2003 Setup map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook savedefault ls /usbdrive.tag || find --set-root --ignore-cd /usbdrive.tag configfile /winsetup.lst title Start Vista/Win7/Server 2008 Setup or PE/Recovery ISO from partition 0 map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook root (hd0,0) chainloader /bootmgr ```

and Winsetup.lst
``` color black/cyan yellow/cyan timeout 10 default /windefault title Back to Main Menu configfile /menu.lst title First part of Windows XP Professional SP3 setup from partition 0 map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook ls /WINSETUP/XPpSP3.ISO || find --set-root --ignore-cd /WINSETUP/XPpSP3.ISO map /WINSETUP/XPpSP3.ISO (0xff) || map --mem /WINSETUP/XPpSP3.ISO (0xff) savedefault 2 checkrange 0x00,0x01 read 0x8280 && configfile /BOOTWS/fd.lst checkrange 8 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/8.lst checkrange 7 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/7.lst checkrange 6 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/6.lst checkrange 5 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/5.lst checkrange 4 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/4.lst checkrange 3 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/3.lst checkrange 2 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/2.lst checkrange 1 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/1.lst boot map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook title Second part of 2000/XP/2003 setup / Boot first internal hard disk checkrange 8 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/8.lst checkrange 7 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/7.lst checkrange 6 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/6.lst checkrange 5 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/5.lst checkrange 4 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/4.lst checkrange 3 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/3.lst checkrange 2 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/2.lst checkrange 1 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/1.lst boot ```

Thanks, again

Make the iso file contigious with wincontig > You can copy the xp iso (as one file) to your hard disk first. The installation is much faster > Win7 directly from iso is difficult > > Below are the menu.lst enteries for xp with winvblock usb > > title Install Windows XP from iso with winvblock > find --set-root --ignore-floppies /xpsp3.iso > map /winvblock.ima (fd0) > map /winvblock.ima (fd1) > map /xpsp3.iso (0xff) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd0) (hd1) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > chainloader (0xff) > > title Continue Windows XP setup with winvblock > find --set-root --ignore-floppies /xpsp3.iso > map /winvblock.ima (fd0) > map /winvblock.ima (fd1) > map /xpsp3.iso (0xff) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd0) (hd1) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > chainloader (hd0)+1

I opened the winvblock.ima, followed the Steve instructions and then put all the driver downloaded driver into the winvblock ima file. It told me to overwrite iaStor.sys and other files ¿is it ok?
The motherboard driver is :
ASROCK CONROE 865PE VENDOR=8086 DEVICE=24D1 ICH5 I can't find that driver, but i'll try with this one: [http://devid.info/es/27749](http://devid.info/es/27749 "External link") Thanks again

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
If 24D1 is not in the INF file then it probably won't work. Try adding extra lines by copying an existing section and changing the PCI ID tp 8086 24D1.  
As for overwriting files, I would always use the newest version of the .sys file but it may not work! You can always make one floppy image for the 865 system, and use a different floppy image for other systems if you make a separate menu entry in the grub4dos menu.

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> VENDOR=8086 DEVICE=24D1  
> ICH5
That's IDE emulation mode, that's NOT AHCI mode.  
There is no need to include iastor.sys.  

Read instructions again and try custom ntdetect.com.

It's a special ISO... I want to make an USB for installing XP or Windows 7

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
I think the problem is that the first system has a strange mass storage controller and the 2nd one has slow USB ports.  
MSI N1996 is not the board name, all MSI boards have MSI N1996 on them - the name should be something like MS-6359.  
Did you test your USB drive with RMPrepUSB Quick Size Test?   
For XP set the BIOS HDD mode to IDE not AHCI.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Well you can have two ISOs, but if one is modified it might not work in the same way. I can't really help with the modified one...

forumNotes.author: Mah Moua
forumNotes.content:
The easiest is to boot hiren from grub4dos  
mount the iso (xp or 7) with eg imdisk  
There are 2 "fast" installers under programs/others in hiren's menu one for xp (winntsetup)  
and another for win6/7 (nt6.x fast installer)  

If you want to install xp directly from iso use winvblock. Make the iso file contigious with wincontig  
You can copy the xp iso (as one file) to your hard disk first. The installation is much faster  
Win7 directly from iso is difficult  

Below are the menu.lst enteries for xp with winvblock usb  

title Install Windows XP from iso with winvblock   
find --set-root --ignore-floppies /xpsp3.iso  
map /winvblock.ima (fd0)  
map /winvblock.ima (fd1)  
map /xpsp3.iso (0xff)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd0) (hd1)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd1) (hd0)  
map --hook  
chainloader (0xff)  

title Continue Windows XP setup with winvblock  
find --set-root --ignore-floppies /xpsp3.iso  
map /winvblock.ima (fd0)  
map /winvblock.ima (fd1)  
map /xpsp3.iso (0xff)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd0) (hd1)  
checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 \&\& map (hd1) (hd0)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd0)+1

The motherboard driver is :
ASROCK CONROE 865PE VENDOR=8086 DEVICE=24D1 ICH5 I can't find that driver, but i'll try with this one: [http://devid.info/es/27749](http://devid.info/es/27749 "External link") Thanks again

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
If 24D1 is not in the INF file then it probably won't work. Try adding extra lines by copying an existing section and changing the PCI ID tp 8086 24D1.  
As for overwriting files, I would always use the newest version of the .sys file but it may not work! You can always make one floppy image for the 865 system, and use a different floppy image for other systems if you make a separate menu entry in the grub4dos menu.

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> VENDOR=8086 DEVICE=24D1  
> ICH5
That's IDE emulation mode, that's NOT AHCI mode.  
There is no need to include iastor.sys.  

Read instructions again and try custom ntdetect.com.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: If it's IDe mode then you won't need to select a storage driver. Try just selecting firadisk and winvblock only.

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
Is this a good tested source?  
Is this a USB hard disk filled beyond 128GB and then added Windows 7 setup files?  

Did you use latest WinSetupFromUSB 1.0 beta8?  
It adds a couple of debug startup options for Vista/7 setup, most likely one of them will get you going if the source is confirmed as working one and nothing is wrong with the hardware.
